(a) What happens if a bar magnet is cut into two pieces: (i) transverse to its length, (ii) along its length?
(b) A magnetised needle in a uniform magnetic field experiences a torque but no net force. An iron nail near a bar magnet, however, experiences a force of attraction in addition to a torque. Why?
header_path: 5.2.2 Bar magnet as an equivalent solenoid > Example 5.1
summary: This text discusses the behavior of a bar magnet when cut into two pieces and the forces experienced by different objects near a magnet.
hypothetical_questions: How are the magnetic properties affected when a bar magnet is cut into pieces?
Why does an iron nail near a bar magnet experience both a force and a torque while a magnetised needle near a magnet only experiences a torque?
